Grace knew her cousin Michael had a crush on her, but she didn't think anything it. She just thought of as something that made him even sweeter than he already was.

Fairly soon they arrived at Michael's home.

Michael's mother and father were both highly regard professionals who provided for Michael very, very well but who didn't have as much time as they would like with him. Regardless, you decided to sit and watch the show. The TV was thunderously loud, the gunfire effects rattling through your body, making for a very intense experience. You sat, cross-legged, still under the sofa but close to the opening.

After a while, the giant started to lose a few games and he gave a threatening grunt. You gulped as the giant shifted ahead, perhaps trying to get more comfortable. You certainly didn't want this guy to see you if he was in a bad mood...you withdrew a little bit, just in time for the feet to land on either side of you, directly ahead. They were very far apart, much further than you would have thought, and you imagined being able to see the whole of the giant sitting on the sofa, legs far apart, spreading himself, dominating the space. It made you tremble with excitement. What's more, now you could see the two perfect feet right ahead of you.

They were perfect things, very dark brown, nicely-clipped nails, clean after his recent shower, and really, really big. Even for a giant. You inched forward and stared up at the muscular calves, bulging through a pair of grey tracksuit bottoms that he was using to lounge around in. You gulped, unable to contain your lust for this guy. You wondered if he would notice if you touched the feet...just a little bit. It was a heavy risk, but the more you thought about this guy the more you just didn't care. Or you could be sensible, stick to the plan - wait until you knew more about this guy before taking the risk of revealing yourself.
15533221111111121221122222.title: Woken by the giant sitting on the sofa

155332211111111212211222221.content:
You almost drooled at the sight of the two feet, planted quite a way apart from each other. You made a lust-driven, spur of the moment decision and stepped out from the cover of the sofa, heading towards the left foot. As you stepped out, you stared in awe at the bulging leg muscles that loomed above you like some kind of ancient monolith. The sounds of the videogame and the giant using the controller were relegated to the background as you got a great view of the giant's face from below. God he was handsome...

You moved on, closer and closer to the left foot, until eventually you reached it. You examined it closely, every line, every imperfection on the skin. You walked to it, walked around it, took in its scent. It smelt fairly clean, but also like a foot, a foot that would utterly dominate if given the chance. It was perfect, the skin tone, the size, the long, meaty, powerful toes and clipped nails...perfection. You couldn't stop yourself - you stroked it. Touched it. You felt your arousal as you did it, the warmth of the giant's skin transferring to you, causing you to shudder. It felt great, smooth, magnificent. You walked around to the toes now and knelt, licking the second toe and feeling between them.

Then you realized the stupidity of what you were doing. Had the giant noticed?
155332211111111212211222221.title: Give in. Go and stroke those perfect feet.

choices: Yes, made it under the couch!
No. The giant saw you and stopped you!
1553322111111112122112222211.content:
The huge toes suddenly moved upwards, like a pair of eyebrows raising in surprise. It was a reaction to the contact you'd made, and you gasped suddenly. You bolted. Luckily, the giant's legs were so far forward that his knees actually obscured his line of sight to his foot. This gave you the briefest opportunity to bolt back towards the safety of the couch, which you did.

"What the hell?" came a huge, booming voice. A deep, Yorkshire accent which sent shivers down your spine as you sprinted, diving for the crack in the couch. Did you make it?
1553322111111112122112222211.title: Yes - he looks down

155332211111111212212.content: Even though the guy was incredibly attractive, you decided that you were looking for more than just physique. You were looking for something else. You didn't know what but you had a feeling you'd know it when you saw it. So on you went until you reached the end of the street. You looked off into the distance where you could see taller buildings, skyscrapers. You decided that maybe now would be the time to make for the city centre and have a look around the offices and whatnot. Or you could stay in the suburbs and look around there.
155332211111111212212.title: No - keep walking on down the street

choices: The dog saw and tried to chase you
15533221111111121222.content:
In the distance - but a distance that could be covered in seconds by a giant, you wagered - you spotted an enormous dog, out for an early-morning walk with its master. You didn't get a look at the human being, though, because you were too busy blanching with fear at the sight of the monstrous German Shepard. Invincibility or not, being eaten and digested by a dog would be a horrid experience that you wanted absolutely no part of.

So you decided instead to hurry across the road. There were no cars coming so it was easy enough to do.
15533221111111121222.title: An animal of some kind. Time to run!

choices: Keep trying to get under the car!
155332211111111212221.content:
Unfortunately, this little avoidance tactic didn't work. The German Shepard's sense of smell, its awareness, was simply too strong and it noticed you. You moving a bit faster across the street probably didn't help, but you imagined it would have found you no matter what you did.

Because suddenly, you heard a horribly loud bark from the dog, a bark that you thought should level houses. And then he barked it again, and again. A non-invincible tiny would probably go deaf, you thought, as you chanced a glance backwards to see the dog suddenly pulling on the lead of its master and trying to get to you. Its big, black eyes were locked directly on you and you sprinted as fast as you could. You had no idea where you were going...then you spotted a car parked in the road not too far from you. You made for it, since hiding under there would probably be your safest bet. There was no way a dog that size would ever make it under there and surely the master would eventually pull him away.

"HUGO!" screamed a voice that you paid no attention to. You couldn't even identify a gender, such was your terror. But at least now the monstrous dog had a name.

You sprinted for the car, which had seemed close at first but such was your anxiety it now seemed further and further away. You estimated you were about 10 seconds from it, though.

"Ah!" you heard the yell of the master and looked back. Hugo had pulled himself free of the giant human's grip and, after a moment's hesitation, started tearing towards you! You looked straight ahead and committed to the sprint, but the car was surely too far away at the pace Hugo was closing in.

There was a drain cover to your left, though. Diving in could be your only chance to avoid being dog excrement.
155332211111111212221.title: The dog saw and tried to chase you

choices: Thrown out of a pipe and into the ocean!
Deposited in the sewer itself...now what?
1553322111111112122211.content:
Consumed by total panic and terror, you took a spur of the moment decision. The dog was getting way too close and you didn't think you had a chance of making the car. So you decided to do the only thing you could to effort the terrifying monster - hop into the drain.

You hurled yourself in recklessly with a degree of pain, banging off the side of the metal and falling deep into the deep, dark pit before landing with a splash in the stinking water. You struggled to keep afloat and tried to look up to see if Hugo was still there, looking for you, but before you knew it the current had taken you. You had no idea where you were going, and it was all you could do to avoid drowning!

Where do you end up?
1553322111111112122211.title: Hop into the drain!

choices: Go back the way you came
Go forward and find another way out of the sewer.
15533221111111121222112.content:
You had absolutely no idea where you were. You'd splashed to the surface of the filthy water but now a flood of water was taking you every which way. It was almost completely dark, you had no idea which way was up, and you had no idea if your head was even above water. You shut your eyes, accepting that it was completely useless to resist this current, and prayed this would be over soon. It was deeply unpleasant - the smell, the feel, the random objects that hit you...you didn't even want to imagine what they were.

After a few minutes, you struck something hard and metallic. Then, shortly after that, the chaos stopped. You realized you weren't being dragged along anymore and the water was more calm. So you opened one eye a crack and looked around. You could see a light up above! Letting the last gasp of air out of your mouth, you made for the surface and broke the water, coughing and spluttering.

The sewer. You were in the sewer. It utterly stank, so much so that you gagged before breathing through your mouth. Looking around, you noticed a set of stairs leading into the water and you swam over to it, using the well-worn, chipped concrete to climb your way out. You fell onto your back, completely exhausted, trying to get your breath.

About 20 minutes later, you stood up and climbed another step, then another, until after 5 or 6 you were at the top. You looked around. Off in the distance were some...bars, almost like a prison, in the middle of the sewer canal. There were floor-to-ceiling and covered by a concrete arch. That must have been the metallic thing you struck on the way down, so that was the way you came from. You could back that way, try and find a way up that might be somewhere roughly similar to where you started, or head in the opposite direction and look for another way out.
15533221111111121222112.title: Deposited in the sewer itself...now what?

choices: Uh-oh. The rats. They're right here.
155332211111111212221122.content:
You decided that you'd simply gone too far to make it back to where you were, so trying to get back that way was simply a fool's errand. You decided instead to head in the opposite direction, hoping you'd find any kind of exit or relief from the foul smell that enveloped you.

Soon enough the metal bars were out of sight. The walk continued almost endlessly. It felt like it had been 30 minutes and there had been little change in the scenery... still the same long, drab, vile corridor, with the daunting sounds of rats nearby and the rushing of water. You were thinking of taking a break as you rounded one last corner to see...
155332211111111212221122.title: Go forward and find another way out of the sewer.

choices: A break or meeting room for the sewer workers.
1553322111111112122211222.content:
You were about to sit down by the wall for a bit. You needed a break because of the sheer mind-numbing tedium of this disgusting walk, when you saw something new. A blue/grey door. Above it was a harsh strip-light, making it stand out even more.

Raising your eyebrows, you decided to head inside. Who knows what might be in there? You walked up to the door and listened. Nothing. So you got down on your belly and crawled through the crack. On the other side was...
1553322111111112122211222.title: A door of some sort...

15533221111111121222112221.content:
Inside the room was a gigantic steel table, some folding chairs, and a counter with a coffee machine. There was also a whiteboard which showed various shifts and other information for the sewer workers. And what looked like a bathroom with a shower. Definitely useful.

What's more, at the far end of the room was an elevator! Would it take you out? You wondered.

But these thoughts were not your first. The first thing you noticed was that the room was...
15533221111111121222112221.title: A break or meeting room for the sewer workers.

155332211111111212221122212.content:
Seeing the room was unoccupied, you weren't sure if that was a good thing or not. On the one hand, it meant you didn't have to worry about any...opportunistic giants snatching you up, but on the other it robbed you of the chance to hitch a ride on one of them out of the sewer. You knew you had very little chance of getting up a ladder or something so you'd likely need some human assistance.

The good news was this break room was certainly not abandoned. The coffee machine had a filter in it and in general it didn't seem particularly dusty or anything. The room had seen use, and recently too. And, best of all - there was a big pile of cleaning products, boxes of tissue, coffee filters, etc that looked easily climbable.

So now you knew the room was empty you had a choice. You could definitely climb up those boxes and get under the sink to take a much-needed bath/shower, or go and sit by the elevator waiting to jump into it as soon as it opened. Though you had no idea where it might take you, or if it was even in regular use.
155332211111111212221122212.title: Unoccupied

1553322111111112122211222121.content:
You decided getting out of the sewer was the more pressing matter for now, and that elevator looked like the best bet. Preparing yourself for a long wait, you trekked over to the other side of the room. You grabbed a tissue from the pile of boxes on the way, dragging it along with you.

By the time you made the imposing, grey elevator door, you were exhausted. It had been quite the morning - escaping a potentially tyrannical giant, a desperate chase involving another potentially tyrannical giant and a crazed dog, a rough ride through a sewer system and a trek through the drains... suffice to say you were exhausted. Using the tissue as a blanket, you huddled into a corner next to the elevator and got some sleep. You knew that the sheer noise of anyone entering the room would wake you.

And, sure enough, a couple of hours later that's exactly what happened. But where had this person come from?
1553322111111112122211222121.title: Wait by the elevator

choices: Yes - one of the men saw movement at his feet. Uh-oh!
15533221111111121222112221212.content:
You were woken with a start by the noise of the elevator in motion, and realised this was the moment. Standing up, you crept closer to the elevator door, pressing tight against the wall and peering around the corner. You were confident you wouldn't be seen at this angle.

Sure enough, the elevator doors opened up a few minutes later with a "ding". Out poured not just one man but two more, talking loudly and boisterously, all wearing high-vis jackets and hard hats. You had expected odor but there was none; they actually smelt quite good. Must be the start of the shift, not the end.

However, you were determined to get out of the sewer, interesting as these men might be. Once they walked past you, you sprinted through the elevator door, hurling yourself across the gap and landing safely inside!

But had you been spotted?
15533221111111121222112221212.title: The elevator - time to run!

choices: Didn't make it! Pinned in mid-air by Hugo's paw. Now what?
1553322111111112122212.content: In that split second, you decided that the car was close enough and the prospect of diving into a drain unattractive enough that you'd risk continuing. So you kept on sprinting towards the car. Two shadows loomed over you suddenly - that of the car's trunk, and also of the gigantic Hugo. You wailed as you made one final leap to safety...
1553322111111112122212.title: Keep trying to get under the car!

choices: The giant master has seen you and is going to try and get you out of there.
The giant master comes over to look. Do you hide in time?
15533221111111121222121.content:
Hugo's paw swiped through the air just above you as you landed face first on the gravel. You winced a little but there wasn't much pain due to your invincibility. If anything, the pain was psychosomatic. You got up again and sprinted further, further until you were in the dead centre of the car's shadow. Only then, gasping for air and incredibly relieved, did you risk looking around to see what had happened to the dog.

You weren't out of this yet. Hugo the dog had his face buried under the car and was trying his best to get the rest of his body in but couldn't, just about. You gave a little laugh of relief and flipped the bird at the dog. You knew it was a futile gesture, but it made you feel better. Now you just needed the giant master to come and take the dog away.

It occurred to you that the human might look when they eventually arrived...look to see what all the fuss was about. Or maybe they'd even seen you already. You really hadn't given it much thought. Regardless, you figured it was better to get out of their way. You didn't want to risk being captured and brought to the same house as Hugo...you shuddered at the thought of being trapped in the same building as that thing. Tim Dantry was infinitely preferable, even if this person ended up being perfect. So you turned and ran again, this time towards the front left corner of the car. You figured you could hide in the tyre.
15533221111111121222121.title: Made it!

155332211111111212221212.content:
You heard a voice, and now in your calm state you were able to discern a little bit about Hugo's owner.

"What got into you?" asked the voice. "What's under there?"

The master was a...
155332211111111212221212.title: The master

1553322111111112122212121.content:
The depth of the voice indicated that the giant walking Hugo was definitely a man, and you could make out a pair of sneakers and dark blue jeans. But that could really be any age, ethnicity, height...you still knew nothing about this guy. Certainly not if he was trustworthy. And owning Hugo was definitely a huge negative in your eyes. So you kept sprinting for the tyre, ready to hop inside the metal.

Do you make it?
1553322111111112122212121.title: Man

choices: Yep - tumble out of the tyre and back onto the street before the driver leaves
Nope - stuck in the tyre as this person drives away!
15533221111111121222121211.content:
You jumped as high and as far as you could, hurtling yourself at the tyre. Air rushed around you in the relative darkness as you flew recklessly inside, the spaces in the hubcap more than big enough for you to nestle comfortably. You fell to the bottom, a slightly painful drop but ultimately you were invincible so it was fine. You breathed deeply, straining your ears, waiting to hear something from the owner of the monstrous dog.

"What's wrong with you?" boomed a man's voice. He sounded young, early 20s maybe. "What's under there?"
Then nothing, except Hugo's aggressive growling and a few booming, terrifying barks. Suddenly the man's voice was a lot louder and more intense, echoing through the cavern that was the underside of the car. "Nothing! Stupid dog."

You sighed with relief, laughing a little to yourself. That had been quite the little adventure!

"Hey man," said the voice of Hugo's owner suddenly.
"What's the dog up to?" came the reply... another man's voice. Who was this?
"Oh, sorry. He thinks he saw something under there. Who knows."
"Hmm. Well, keep his slobber off the paintwork, alright?"
The master's voice laughed. "Will do. Have a good day."

And Hugo's growls suddenly started to grow fainter and more distant...


You frowned for a second, then put two and two together.

Was that...the owner of the car?
And was he about to drive said car?
With you hiding in the tyre?

Your eyes widened and you began trying to make an escape from the tyre. Footsteps came incredibly close to you, then you heard the car door open and, with a deafening slam, close. Uh oh. You yelled out, redoubling your efforts, but the hole was a bit above your head. You'd need to climb!

Do you make it?
15533221111111121222121211.title: Yes

choices: Man and Dog are long gone, no danger there. So what now?
155332211111111212221212111.content: You flung yourself onto the hard tarmac just before the car sped off with a roar. You suddenly realized the trouble you might be in, and scanned around - where was that huge German Shepard now? Was he still around or had the master had a chance to get far enough away with him?
155332211111111212221212111.title: Tumble out of the tyre and back onto the street

choices: Do a little breaking and entering - find a house to invade
That car has given you an idea - find a ride to somewhere else
1553322111111112122212121112.content: With that little adventure over, you were alone again. There was no sign of anybody around and the early morning sun was still shining down on you. You smiled, happy to be out of trouble for now and feeling the adrenaline, the thrill of adventure, flowing through your veins. You wanted more, so you wondered what you could do next.
1553322111111112122212121112.title: Man and Dog are gone, no danger there. What now?

choices: The car had stopped at the car owner's work.
The car had stopped miles out of the city at a remote gas station.
155332211111111212221212112.content:
You clambered to the metal of the tyre and began to make an escape but it was no use. The car roared into life, the engine vibrating through the entire vehicle and causing you to lose your grip. You tumbled back inside the tyre and gulped. This would be unpleasant!

The car moved off with shocking speed and, with it, the wheel you were inside began to turn. You were thrown about as if in a washing machine, constantly hitting the metal. Without your invincibility you would be completely dead, a small mess on the pavement or inside this wheel or something. But instead you had to endure a vomit-inducing fate such as this one.

You lost all sense of time as you were span around, vomiting up the last thing you ate and praying for it to stop. Eventually, though, you started to slip in and out of consciousness, any thought of escape from the tyre long gone. By the time you fully came to...
155332211111111212221212112.title: Nope: stuck in the tyre as this person drives off!

choices: Head into the post office building
1553322111111112122212121121.content: Exhausted, you clambered out of the tyre and onto a gas station forecourt. You stumbled out from underneath the car and looked around to see that the driver of the car had taken you to...the post office? You could see the sign atop the door. The giant had already gone inside, so you were all alone out here. What could you do now? Maybe you could walk around and explore, or maybe you could head into the post office, see what the driver was up to.
1553322111111112122212121121.title: The car had stopped at the car owner's work.

choices: Try and get into the car itself
Sneak into the gas station and see what you can see
1553322111111112122212121122.content:
Exhausted, you clambered out of the tyre and onto a gas station forecourt. You stumbled out from underneath the car and looked around. It looked like the gas station was in the middle of nowhere - there were no buildings nearby. Nobody on the forecourt either except your guy, who you could hear humming as he filled up the tank - even if he was out of sight for now.

No matter what, you knew you absolutely had to avoid being stuck in the tyre again. It had been a horrible, painful experience that you were still recovering from. You were filthy, covered in vomit and sweat and dirt and dust.

You coughed a few times and started to assess options.

You could try and find your way into the comfort of the car itself and see where this guy was going, or you could venture into the gas station, maybe hitch a ride back to civilization with one of the employees in there.
1553322111111112122212121122.title: At a gas station

choices: Wait for someone else to arrive
15533221111111121222121211222.content:
You headed across the forecourt and headed into the gas station. Just as you entered, the owner of the car swung the door open and you dove to the floor in a fetal position, but he just stepped straight over you, striding to his car and driving away. You shrugged. Guess you weren't going back with him.

So you headed into the brightly-lit station. There was nobody there except one bored-looking cashier who was sat playing with his phone. You couldn't really get a good look at him. You dug around a little bit and found some candy, tearing into it with some effort and helping yourself. You didn't think anybody would miss it.

You moved so you were out of sight of the cashier and sat down, munching your candy and thinking. If you got bored enough you could make contact with the cashier, or instead you could wait until someone else came in and hitch-hike with them.
15533221111111121222121211222.title: Sneak into the gas station

choices: Stay in this guy's luggage. Who knew where he was headed?
Once you're at the airport, get out of the bag and catch a different flight.
155332211111111212221212112222.content:
After waiting an hour, eventually someone else showed up. It was a pretty average-looking guy with black hair and a little bit of stubble. He was wearing a t-shirt and three-quarter length trousers, and shades.

You listened into the conversation he had with the cashier.

"Nice ride," said the cashier. He sounded pretty young.
"Only a rental, sadly," said the new guy, and there was a little bit of regret in his voice.
"Oh?"
"Yeah, I'm taking it back to the airport now. Flying home later."
"Ah...well, enjoy it while it lasts!"

Your eyes widened. The airport! If you wanted an adventure there'd be no better place to go - because you could go anywhere you wanted! As the giants completed their transaction, you sprinted back across the baking forecourt and to the giant's car. It was indeed a sweet ride - a blue convertible. The giant was on the way back, and you decided to use him to your advantage. One of his trainers had a dangling shoelace, which you grabbed onto for a second as he climbed into the car. Before you knew it, you were in the car's footwell and scrambling under the seat. Safe from prying eyes. You climbed through as the car started and came out the other side of the seat. On the back seat was the giant's carry-on luggage, so with the giant speeding down the road to the airport you unzipped the bag and forced yourself into a side pocket.

Time to head to the airport.
155332211111111212221212112222.title: A tourist arrives

1553322111111112122212121122222.content:
After a while, and some chaotic movement, you heard frantic footsteps, noise, and announcements made over a tannoy. You were at the airport!

You didn't particularly want to go through an x-ray so you decided to try to clamber out of the bag once it stopped. Sure enough, the man you'd stowed away with was soon joining a bag-drop queue. It was busy but you figured nobody would look at the floor too hard, especially with lots of trolleys and stuff to hide under.

So you crawled out, and immediately you were assaulted by the cacophony of footsteps and noise. You'd never been anywhere this crowded before!

Spotting a gap in the crowd of people, you sprinted away from the bag-drop queue and under some nearby benches, breathing a sigh of relief. There was a couple sitting directly above you, but you paid them no heed for now. Instead, you crept up against the side of the bench to give yourself as much cover as possible before peering out, looking for the departure board.

Soon enough, you found it. So where did you want to go?
1553322111111112122212121122222.title: At the airport!

choices: He sees you and is able to pull you out of there.
You evade the light and get out of the tyre!
15533221111111121222121212.content:
You leapt into the tyre with reckless abandon, smacking your head on the metal as you went.

Woozily, you got up, only to hear a rough voice saying "that was a little person!" in a state of shock. Uh-oh. He was on to you.

You weren't sure how to proceed - better to let this guy make the first move. You heard and felt pounding footsteps as they approached the tyre on the drivers' side door. "I know you're in there, little man," said a sinister voice. "Or woman," it added. You rolled your eyes. But now you knew where he was - the door side. You could simply sneak out the other side and-

Bright light burned through your thoughts as the inside of the tyre was lit up like the inside of a disco ball. You shielded your eyes as the flashlight from Hugo's master's phone shone through the darkness, searching for you!
15533221111111121222121212.title: No

choices: The owner of the car arrives and joins the hunt!
The dog owner gets bored and leaves
155332211111111212221212122.content:
Panicking, you scrambled out of the tyre, away from the light. You were glad to evade it, but you weren't out of trouble yet. You sprinted across the front of the car to the other tyre, climbing into that one too and praying you'd evaded that awful dog and his apparently equally awful owner.

Instead, you heard a low laugh. "I know you're here," he said. "You'll have to come out eventually."

But the voice was still far away, by the first tyre. Maybe you'd successfully evaded him!
155332211111111212221212122.title: You evade the light and get out of the tyre!

choices: Try and find somewhere else in the kitchen to hide!
15533221111111122.content:
You decide not to risk it. Waiting here is still better than waiting next to the front door and hoping Tim opens it long enough to slip out. That draught was definitely coming from somewhere down there. So you sat at the edge of the void, legs dangling, waiting nervously.

You'd never been out of the sight of your protectors before, so this was a whole new experience for you. You have to admit, it was exciting! Maybe you should have taken more risks before. After all, you were invincible. But, you thought, that could work against you if you were captured. Tim, for instance, could make your life a total hell with no real consequences. Still, once you got safe you'd talk to your brother and his friends in the door about living a bit more freely.

Suddenly, though, the fear that you'd experienced a lot in the last 24 hours returned as you heard thunderous movements from upstairs. Tim was out of bed, stumbling around...the blood left your face. You hoped against hope that he'd just go back to bed, as the ceiling above you seemed to shake with his footsteps, but then you heard the rumble of his voice. "Little man?" he called out. "Little man?" his voice rose with something like concern. You screwed up your face. Maybe escaping wasn't the best idea...but you were pretty set on it for now, so you put that idea out of your mind.

Suddenly the footsteps grew louder and louder, more pronounced, more terrifying. Tim was approaching the stairs. You looked down into the hole. It was still too dark to see anything! But it might be the only way to escape the behemoth.
15533221111111122.title: Be patient and wait until morning!

choices: Tim keeps looking for you downstairs - does he find you?
Tim gets ready to leave for work - time to make your escape!
155332211111112.content:
You decide that your best bet will be to simply wait until Tim opens the door in the morning and then slip out. There's a shoe-rack near the door, upon which are several different pairs of shoes - smart dress shoes, a couple of pairs of trainers, that sort of thing. You roll underneath it, which gives you more than enough cover, and decide to fall asleep where you are.

You are awoken a few hours later by a thunderous yell from upstairs. "LITTLE MAN?" came the voice and you winced. Tim was looking for you! You could hear stuff in the bedroom being moved around as Tim searched frantically for you. You just stayed still, wincing as each fresh object hit the floor, as Tim stomped around. "Son of a bitch!" Tim yelled aloud. "Where did he go?"

Eventually, the noise stopped and you heard a huge sigh from the bedroom. Then, the footstops grew louder and more intense as Tim thundered down the steps.
155332211111112.title: Try and slip out

choices: No, but he leaves - you're stuck in the house!
